meanings.sent1: The storm stroyed the old barn.
meanings.sent2: The kids accidentally stroyed their sandcastle.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy stroyed the garden, digging up all the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The chef stroyed the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent5: The careless painter stroyed the canvas with a misplaced brushstroke.

meanings.definition: To completely destroy or demolish something
meanings.sent1: The earthquake stroyed the entire city.
meanings.sent2: The demolition crew stroyed the old building in seconds.
meanings.sent3: The toddler stroyed the tower of blocks with a single push.
meanings.sent4: The fire stroyed all evidence of the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The tornado stroyed everything in its path, leaving only rubble behind.
